person.persName: Solomon Pittman (Pulaski County, Kentucky, resident and soldier)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. South Carolina native. Son of James Pittman and Emelline Pittman. Resident of Pulaski County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861 to January 12, 1865. Absent without leave from June 20, 1862 to January 18, 1863. Court martialed and sentenced to forfeit pay and hard labor on May 14, 1863. Returned to service. Wounded at the Battle of Campbell's Station, Knox County, Tennessee, on November 16, 1863.
